definition: to run into/to come upon/to meet
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
a blind cat finds a dead mouse (idiom)/blind luck
pinyin: xia1 mao1 peng4 shang4 si3 hao4 zi5

sentences.english: At about half the distance to Zunyi, I came across a long line of cars.
sentences.chinese: 大约在去遵义的半道上我碰上了一串车排起了长龙。

sentences.english: Lucia was shopping when she suddenly bumped into her old friend Debra.
sentences.chinese: 露西亚购物时碰上了老朋友黛布拉。

sentences.english: They never ignore any tatters, even an iron piece would bring them crazy joyous.
sentences.chinese: 破布烂衫不放过，碰上铁器喜如狂。

sentences.english: Many misfortunes came on us during that harsh winter.
sentences.chinese: 在那个严峻的寒冬，很多倒霉事都让我们碰上了。

sentences.english: The second was a 14-year-old kid from London.
sentences.chinese: 碰上的第二个人是一个14岁的伦敦小孩。

sentences.english: In the happy end on the bus, I met a wage reform.
sentences.chinese: 在快乐的末班车上，我碰上了工资改革。

sentences.english: It had just entered a stormy area with strong turbulence, she said.
sentences.chinese: 飞机只是刚飞进雷电区就碰上了强气流，她说道。

sentences.english: The winds were contrary;we had to beat about for two days.
sentences.chinese: 正碰上逆风，我们的船只好迎斜风行驶了两天。

sentences.english: Push to the side, and glide…… Knees together when you recover, and try to pull your foot in.
sentences.chinese: 侧蹬，然后滑行，收腿时膝盖要碰上，脚尽量往里收。

sentences.english: Who did Woody meet at Al's Toy Barn?
sentences.chinese: 伍迪在艾尔的玩具仓里都碰上了谁？

sentences.english: The soldiers went on the prowl hoping to meet some girls.
sentences.chinese: 逛来逛去，希望碰上花姑娘。

sentences.english: Hit men, then women can also become hard-soft.
sentences.chinese: 碰上男人，再硬的女人也会变软。

sentences.english: When Collet read the label above the empty peg, he knew he was in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 科莱读了空栓上面的标签，马上明白自己碰上了麻烦。

sentences.english: Bad luck, I hope,won't hook on to me in two days.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这两天让我别碰上什么倒霉事。

sentences.english: Those of black smoke came damp, suddenly, the guy red sad.
sentences.chinese: 羞涩的眼色碰上受潮的烟，倏忽，哀愁的眼孔通红。

sentences.english: I stubbed my toe against the foot of the table.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚趾碰上了桌子腿。

definition: to come across/to run into/to meet/to hit
to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
if it were not for/but for
as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
